content: Ibrahim's personal corner Ibrahim NumanagiÄ‡ IPA ibrÄƒ:xim numÃ¢:nagitÉ• English (kind of) ibrahim numanaggich Arabic or Farsi Ø§Ø¨Ø±Ø§Ù‡ÛŒÙ… Ù†Ø¹Ù…Ø§Ù† Ø§Ù‚Ø§ Ø²Ø§Ø¯Ù‡ Cyrillic Ğ¸Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ñ…Ğ¸Ğ¼ Ğ½ÑƒĞ¼Ğ°Ğ½Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¸Ñ› Chinese (sort of) æ˜“åœæ‹‰è¾› æ€’é©¬é‚£ä¸ªå¥‡ Absolutely wrong numae-na-jik Joe Sacco's "The War on Gaza" Support people of Palestine ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¸ Selam alejkum and hello there! Welcome, welcome! You have stumbled upon a web page of an assistant professor in Computer Science and a Canada Research Chair (Tier 2) at the University of Victoria in Victoria, B.C., Canada ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¦. Note: I am currently looking for new PhD and MSc students to join my lab in Fall 2025. All positions will be funded. Go here for more details about UVic. If you are interested in computational biology, compilers, programming languages and algorithm design and do not mind moving to Victoria, please send me an email. All prospective candidates must have a strong background in Python and C/C++. All inquiry emails must contain the string "Lab 0xTCG" to be considered. Note: Due to the volume of applications, I will not respond to all received applications (and even if I respond, it will be in late November/early December). If you do not hear back from me by December 15, I suggest applying elsewhere. Please do not send reminder emails. In the past, he was a postdoctoral associate in the Computation and Biology Group at the MIT CSAIL ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸, under the supervision of prof. Bonnie Berger. Before that, he was a Ph.D. student and a Vanier Scholar in the Computational Biology Lab at Simon Fraser University ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¦ under the supervision of prof. S. Cenk Åahinalp. He completed his undergraduate studies in the Faculty of Mathematics and Natural Sciences at the University of Sarajevo ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡¦. He originally comes from a beautiful Sarajevo, the capital city of Bosnia and Herzegovina ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡¦. Curriculum Vitae My research interests include bioinformatics (with particular emphasis on computational genomics), programming languages, and secure computing. Major projects include Aldy, Codon, Seq, BISER, SCALCE and so on. You can check the papers I co-authored on Google Scholar. If you're interested in more details, please drop me an email. Contact Questions, requests, typo reports? Feel free to contact me at inumanag at uvic dot oh canada or ibrahim at saray dot oh canada. Bear in mind that I am a notoriously slow email responder. âŠ• The style is inspired by Tufte CSS. I do sometimes wonder if this site can really survive without the useless Â© MMXXV signage?
